description: Documentation was not clearly instructure & not working same as windows

Earlier it didnt work for me, now it does correctly 
Image display unfortunately very little, hard to recognise in display.
Sugestion - I think that setting 'add images to clipboard history' should be ON BY DEFAULT , as this distinctive feature is useful while not everyone would "dig in settings"
Also I wonder where on linux the app stores temporary data of copied texts, it would be nice to have it possible to sheck in settings and maybe configure, in case of some problems
summary: Very nice for text and images too, just not too intuitive on start

All works, Ubuntu 19.04
simple , stable, nice
great tool, I've been using it for many years
summary: great tool, I've been using it for many years

description: it didn't record anything from the clipboard

I used Ubuntu 20.04. Since I had migrated from windows, it was a real pain to work without copy paste menus, as I was used to this. This software made my experience with Ubuntu much like windows. I can copy and paste the way I could in windows. The bonus is that I can see the list of items copied, therefore pick up some old items. Have tried the program in various situation like 1) copying text from website 2) copying text from documents.3) copying entire sheets from libre calc aka spreadsheets. Works excellent. A must download. And yes it can be customised. The list of copied items to be stored can be fixed. Let me repeat it works on Ubuntu 20.04 and is a must have incase you use libre office on daily basis. Doing without it is a going to be a challenge. In Ubuntu, one can select and paste items, easily, but this is a new habit they you will have to learn.
summary: Works perfectly well. It has to be customized

description: I have used Diodon in Ubuntu 16.04, 18.04, 19.10 and now 20.04. It always just works. It certainly works from Ctrl+C and mouse. I am now in the process of installing it in my sixth laptop. I would not be without it.
summary: Diadon is a great utility that I use all the time

description: The program itself starts, nevertheless I still canot make it work...
nothing gets added to the manager when copying with ctrl-C (Ubuntu 20.04LTE)

Seems perfect overal but one thing! It's good open nicely few times and then just not open and I need to wait few second. System was not in load, many CPU and RAM. I even tried to make maximum priority of the diodon proccess, but it didn't help. Seems like program lagging to open some times and I just don't know why. For some reason it's too hard to find simple and fast clipboard nowadays...
works Ubuntu 19.10 well !
summary: Simple & easy, just tap and works fine

description: simple and great
It does exactly what I needed.

Created a Shortcut in the Gnome settings to run /usr/bin/diodon and added it to my auto starting apps.
All other clipboard managers had broken hotkey since ubuntu 20.04 so this is great!
summary: Finally something that just does what I need!

description: Works fine. You may have to open, quit and reopen the app after first install
tried it on ubuntu 20.04, failed to ever see the history, but could be user-error

Works very well in all programs. I am using the Ubuntu 20.04 default GUI. 

Assign it to the Windows + V hotkey if your muscle memory should also work under Windows 10.

runs and installs itself into startup apps on ubuntu 20.04. But after several ctrl-c attempts and several right-click context menu copies would not show in history. Tried preferences and had ctrl-c checked. Spent 20 minutes trying to get some use out of, then removed it and installed parcellite, my favorite. These "new and improved" managers are showing me nothing, clipit would but too much trouble to edit history.Had to give 1 star to post, but that is generous for an app that doesn't work.
Saves a great deal to time and effort.
just does not work.
Thanks for forcing me to try to use this
summary: Clipit worked great This forget about it

description: I think many people tried this tool without rebooting the system first. Yes, if you install it and use it straight away it won't work, but after rebooting it does. Good tool btw!

Très bon petit logiciel de presse-papier qui permet de garder en mémoire l'historique de tout les copier fait.
Manque selon moi de pouvoir copier des images ou captures d'écran.
Et surtout un raccourci clavier personnalisable afin d'ouvrir la fenêtre du presse-papier n'importe ou sur l'écran afin de gagner en productivité.
